A Constructive_geometry is defined as a type of Representation that contains a collection of geometric elements used to support the definition of a Geometric_ model. issue.description: Measurement_path for straight lines can in some cases be adequately specified by a direction . Change to defined_by: curve_or_direction_select

comment.description: Agree, but Measurement_path is harmonized with AP214. However, 214 does not support Measurement_path on all location dimensions, which has been submitted as a SEDS on AP214, because without Measurement_path there is no way to specify a measurement direction, for linear, and for angle dimensions. If 214 accepts the SEDS then this comment should be accepted.

It is true that many measurement paths are straight lines. However, in such cases the path is apparently assumed to be a straight line between the situation features (centerlines, tangent planes, etc - may extend beyond the part boundary) that are used to locate the nominal features. In these cases there is usually not a need to model the explicit path. However, if dimension is directional or if there may be ambiguity as to the sense of the displacement, as for an angle, then some means is needed to establish the direction. A measurement path that is a direction suffices.
